item.title: Building Magic Squares using Python
item.description: A magic square is a n x n square grid (where n is the number of cells on each side) filled with distinct positive integers in the range 1,2,â€¦,n^2 such that each cell contains a different integer and the sum of the integers in each row, column and diagonal is equal. library(reticulate) class MagicSquare: # Create an object with the MagicSquare side size as an input. # It's properties are the sideLength and a grid - two-dimensional list # representing the content of the MagicSquare.
